abstract.abstracttext:
To compare the safety and efficacy of intraoperative
5-fluorouracil
or Intraoperative
mitomycin
C in eyes undergoing primary trabeculectomy.

One hundred fifteen eyes of 103
patients
with uncontrolled intraocular pressure despite maximally tolerated medical therapy or laser were prospectively randomized in a double-masked fashion to one of two treatment groups in a single institution setting. Subject's eyes underwent primary trabeculectomy with either topical 5-Fluorouracil (50 mg/ml for 5 minutes) or topical Mitomycin C (0.2 mg/ml for 2 minutes). Primary outcome measures included the number of eyes achieving target
pressures
of 21, 18, 15, and 12 mmHg at 6 and 12 months postoperatively. Secondary outcome measures included Intraocular Pressure, best-corrected visual acuity, complications, and interventions.

Our study suggests that intraoperative topical 5-Fluorouracil is at least as effective as intraoperative topical Mitomycin C in reducing Intraocular Pressure of eyes undergoing primary trabeculectomy.

body.title: A prospective randomized trial comparing intraoperative 5-fluorouracil vs mitomycin C in primary trabeculectomy.
